metadata.title: CVE-2021-29457 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Exiv2 is a command-line utility and C++ library for reading, writing,deleting, and modifying the metadata of image files. A heap buffer overflowwas found in Exiv2 versions v0.27.3 and earlier. The heap overflow istriggered when Exiv2 is used to write metadata into a crafted image file.An attacker could potentially exploit the vulnerability to gain codeexecution, if they can trick the victim into running Exiv2 on a craftedimage file. Note that this bug is only triggered when _writing_ themetadata, which is a less frequently used Exiv2 operation than _reading_the metadata. For example, to trigger the bug in the Exiv2 command-lineapplication, you need to add an extra command-line argument such as`insert`. The bug is fixed in version v0.27.4.

criterions.comment: exiv2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
